remarks: The set of functionals having closed kernels and majorizing the orthocomplement of a given subspace ` Q ` is closed under scalar product.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lclkrslem1.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkrslem1.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrslem1.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrslem1.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` U ) $.
lclkrslem1.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lclkrslem1.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lclkrslem1.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lclkrslem1.r $e |- R = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lclkrslem1.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
lclkrslem1.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` D ) $.
lclkrslem1.c $e |- C = { f e. F | ( ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) ) = ( L ` f ) /\ ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) C_ Q ) } $.
lclkrslem1.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkrslem1.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. S ) $.
lclkrslem1.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. C ) $.
lclkrslem2.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` D ) $.
lclkrslem2.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. C ) $.
lclkrslem2 $p |- ( ph -> ( E .+ G ) e. C ) $.
